abstract: Britain’s Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn's pronouncement that he would order military not to use nuclear weapons if he were prime minister creates uproar in British parliament; reaction to statement underscores not only sharp divisions in party but also difficulties Corbyn faces as left-leaning politician who wants to remain credible as potential future prime minister of Britain.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Corbyn raised new questions from members of his own party about whether he would be a good choice to lead Britain’s military, one of the world’s most powerful.

headline.main: Jeremy Corbyn, Labour Party Leader, Says He’d Never Use Nuclear Weapons
headline.print_headline: Labour Leader’s Remarks on Nuclear Arms Cause Uproar

snippet: Mr. Corbyn raised new questions from members of his own party about whether he would be a good choice to lead Britain’s military, one of the world’s most powerful.
